page.title: El Salvador national under-23 football team

{{Infobox National football team | Name = El Salvador Under 23 | Badge = FESFUT logo.svg | Badge_size = 200px | FIFA Trigramme = SLV | Nickname = | Association = [[FederaciÃ³n SalvadoreÃ±a de FÃºtbol|FederaciÃ³n SalvadoreÃ±a
de FÃºtbol]] | Confederation = [[CONCACAF]] (North America) | Coach = [[RubÃ©n Israel]], [[Mauricio Alfaro]] | Captain = |pattern_la1= |pattern_b1=_els11h |pattern_ra1= |pattern_sh1=_els11h |pattern_so1=_els10 |leftarm1=0000FF |body1=0000FF |rightarm1=0000FF |shorts1=0000FF |socks1=0000FF |pattern_la2= |pattern_b2=_els11a |pattern_ra2= |pattern_sh2=_els11a |pattern_so2=_els10 |leftarm2=FFFFFF |body2=FFFFFF |rightarm2=FFFFFF |shorts2=FFFFFF |socks2=0000FF | First game = | Largest win = | Largest loss = }} The '''El Salvador U-23 men's national football team''' is the national under-23 [[Football (soccer)|football]] team of [[El Salvador]] and is controlled by the [[FederaciÃ³n SalvadoreÃ±a de FÃºtbol]]. Its primary role is qualification into the [[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Football Tournament]], the next of which is to be held during the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] in the United Kingdom. ==Olympic's History== At the [[1968 CONCACAF Men's Pre-Olympic Tournament]], El Salvador passed the first round with an aggregated score of 5â1 against {{nft|Cuba}}. For the final round, the national team finished with an aggregate score of 4â1 against {{nft|Trinidad and Tobago}} â three of them were scored by [[Juan RamÃ³n MartÃ­nez]].{{cite web|publisher=Elbaloncuscatleco.com|title=Olympic tournaments|url=http://www.elbaloncuscatleco.com/olimpicos.html|accessdate=2011-04-21|date=}} In the [[1972 CONCACAF Men's Pre-Olympic Tournament]], El Salvador was so close to getting their second participation at the [[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympics]]. In the first round, the national team got an aggregate score of 2â2 against the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] and an aggregate score of 7â2 against {{nft|Barbados}}. The group was tied between El Salvador and the United States, so they had to play in a neutral setting. In regulatory time, the two teams were tied at 0â0. At the end of extra time, the game was tied 1â1 with a goal from [[Victor Manuel Valencia]] (112'). The United States advanced after a crucial victory of 6â5 in a [[Penalty shootout (association football)|penalty shootout]]. The team was coached by Conrado Miranda. At the [[1976 CONCACAF Men's Pre-Olympic Tournament]], El Salvador, at home, surpassed with an aggregate score of 6â1 the preliminary round. In the first round of series B, El Salvador lost with an aggregate score of 1â3 with only goal from Luis RamÃ­rez Zapata. In the [[1980 CONCACAF Men's Pre-Olympic Tournament]], El Salvador lost in an aggregate score of 1â2 (0â2,1â0) against Guatemala. The only goal was scored by Alex Cordero. Coached by [[RaÃºl MagaÃ±a]], they did not participate for that [[Football at the 1980 Summer Olympics|Olympics]]. In the [[1984 CONCACAF Men's Pre-Olympic Tournament]], El Salvador lost in an aggregate score of 0â6 (0â2,0â4) against Guatemala. Coached by [[Contreras Palma]], they did not participate for that [[Football at the 1984 Summer Olympics|Olympics]]. In the [[1988 CONCACAF Men's Pre-Olympic Tournament]], El Salvador won in an aggregate score of 4â3 (1â1,3â2) against Panama. They did not participate for that [[Football at the 1984 Summer Olympics|Olympics]]. The El Salvador U-23 national football team has failed to qualify for the Olympics Games since it became a specifically under-23 competition during the [[1992 Summer Olympics]] in [[Barcelona]], Spain. Previously El Salvador had only once participated at the Olympic Games. They achieved this in their first attempt in 1967 when they qualified to the [[1968 Summer Olympics]]. This qualification was achieved after defeating both Cuba and Trinidad & Tobago in the qualifiers. ==Tournament records== ===Olympic Record=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !Year
